On the previous ones, they were covert and denied and responsiblity: not anymore. Topic.Title: think Sybil's right on this one: we're entering the "parabolic" phase of this market into the Holiday Season

Message.Msg: " this time is short squeeze only. does anyone remember rambus?" wrong...this is Central Banks running the printing presses taking turns: giving the reserves to banks in return for issued debt that can't be covered b/c spending is exceeding GDP's. it's not just in the US. It's a rolling devaluation going on around the world taking turns crushing their own currenncies. And it will go bad but it's unknowable how high the market gets before it does. It's a bad habit the CB's have gotten into but they are gonna keep doing it until something does go bad. With oil way down and gold way down, there's no threat to turning off the printing press right now, so speculation has a green light ahead. You watch.

Message.Title: The analysis that pumped it up
Message.Msg: So 2013 sales are projected at $74 billion, UBS thinks $91B next year, $109B in 2015. So is AMZN going to grow revenues 20+% every year for infinity? Lol. Good for them hope they can make profit, because even if $74 billion projected revenues they don't seem to be making any profits. For all those that say AMZN is not brick and mortar, those 70K of employees may disagree, lol. "Online is the place retailers need to be more than ever. Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN ) will be the big threat to bricks and mortar, as usual. Amazon is hiring an extra 70,000 workers for its fulfillment centers this holiday season, and the company expects an astounding 40% increase in customer demand. Sales are expected by analysts to hit $74 billion for the year for Amazon as it benefits from an overall 12.5% rise in holiday e-tail, as predicted by Deloitte."

Message.Title: AMZN is High Beta QQQ
Message.Msg: AMZN tracks the QQQ's almost identical over the last year, and even more so over the last 6 months. It has significantly more downside volatility relative to the QQQ's, but will almost always play catch up to the upside if money flow continues to come into the Nasdaq. That is what today's trade is all about. Big overall market news flow (GOOG, CMG), coupled with high beta performance chasing, and an options expiration to boot. Throw in a final short squeeze to clear out the shorts before the earnings announcement, and you have all the ingredients for a surprise fall of 10% or more from the pre earnings close to the post earnings close. It may fall from here, or rally into the earnings next week, to 340 and above. But if anybody has any powder left, the smart play will be to play for the downside earnings gap at earnings.

Topic.Title: AMZN is High Beta QQQ

Message.Msg: This is also a heavy volume breakout day, which have more often than not been temporary exhaustion tops in AMZN stock. Throw in next weeks almost certain lousy numbers, and the cartel will have a tough time squeezing higher. They've already done their squeeze today.

Topic.Title: Bought 50 call at 350

Message.Msg: You are talking about this past quarter? The 3rd Q estimates are for NEGATIVE $.09 and $16.77M in revenue. I have no idea what earnings will be because accounting comes into play and tricks can be played however they will most likely miss on revenues in a steady state apples to apples, however their e -publishing business changed and therefore the way they count the revenue (without the revenue actually changing) could make revenue look $1B higher than normal per Paulo Santos and therefore they could report a beat of $.6-$.7B on revenue that is actually a miss by $.3-$.4B. Given that they disclose so few details I could see them not even mentioning this change and it's off to the races once again. Of course if they do the above margins would look even worse than normal.

On September 25, 2013, the new Kindle Fire HD (7 inch), priced at $139, and the Kindle Fire HDX were introduced. The Kindle Fire HDX has a new graphics engine, double the memory, and triple the processor speed of the previous model. The 7-inch and 8.99-inch versions were introduced at $229 and $379 respectfully. 1) Timing 2) Check the best sellers list...
